sentences.en: Do not say anything that may incriminate your friend.
sentences.cn: 不要说任何可能牵连你朋友入罪的话.

sentences.en: Don't say anything that may incriminate your friends.
sentences.cn: 不要说任何可能连累你朋友的话.

sentences.en: He claimed that the drugs had been planted to incriminate him.
sentences.cn: 他声称毒品是别人为了陷害他而故意放在那里的。

sentences.en: He had been forced to incriminate himself in cross - examinations .
sentences.cn: 他在 盘问 中被迫受到牵连.

sentences.en: He is accused of perjury with the intention of incriminate his employer.
sentences.cn: 他被控告犯有意图加罪于其雇主的伪证罪.

sentences.en: He refused to answer questions incriminate himself.
sentences.cn: 他拒绝回答问题,以免显示自己有最.

sentences.en: I'd incriminate myself as well as you.
sentences.cn: 我就会把自己和你都牵连进去.

sentences.en: If you want us to incriminate ourselves in any other way, we are ready.
sentences.cn: 如果你还要我们用其他方式表明我们自己, 我们也愿意.

sentences.en: No one can be forced to incriminate himself.
sentences.cn: 任何人不得被强制自证其罪.

sentences.en: The evidence seemed to incriminate him.

trans.tran_en: to make someone seem guilty of a crime

trans.tran_cn: 使（某人）显得有罪， 牵连， 归罪于，控告，归咎于
